general.summary: Projects a point from the screen to the global space and vice versa
general.ul:
Crayder
Widescreen detection Ralfie
Bug in WorldToScreen

member.name: M:@receivepacket
member.param: [] Contains the packet that was received.
Contains the number of bytes (not cells) that are in the packet
[] Contains the IP address and the port number of the sender of this packet.
member.summary: A packed was received.
member.remarks: You must call this function before receiving the first packet. In other words, you should set up a port in main.
If no port number has been explicitily chosen, the module will listen at port 9930.
This function does not work in the current SA:MP version!
member.returns: The return value of this function is currently ignored.

member.name: M:@receivestring
member.param: [] Contains the message (a zero-terminated string) that was received.
[] Contains the IP address and the port number of the sender of this packet.
member.summary: A packed was received.
member.remarks: The string is in unpacked format if the original packet contained a string in UTF-8 format. Note that messages in the ASCII character set are also UTF-8 compliant.
This function does not work in the current SA:MP version!
member.returns: The return value of this function is currently ignored.

member.name: M:CA_CreateObject
member.syntax: CA_CreateObject(modelid, x, y, z, rx, ry, rz, add)

member.name: M:CA_CreateObject_DC
member.syntax: CA_CreateObject_DC(modelid, x, y, z, rx, ry, rz, drawdistance)

member.name: M:CA_RayCastExplode
member.syntax: CA_RayCastExplode(cX, cY, cZ, Radius, intensity, collisions[][])

member.name: M:CA_RayCastLine
member.syntax: CA_RayCastLine(StartX, StartY, StartZ, EndX, EndY, EndZ, &x, &y, &z)

member.name: M:CA_RayCastMultiLine
member.syntax: CA_RayCastMultiLine(StartX, StartY, StartZ, EndX, EndY, EndZ, retx[], rety[], retz[], retdist[], ModelIDs[], size)

member.name: M:CallLocalFunction
member.param: [] Public function's name
[] Tag/format of each variable
{Float,_} 'Indefinite' number of arguments of any tag
member.summary: Calls a public function from the script in which it is used.
member.returns: The value that the only public function returned.
member.remarks: CallLocalFunction crashes the server if it's passing an empty string.

Format string placeholders:
c - a single character
d - an integer (whole) number
i - an integer (whole) number
x - a number in hexadecimal notation
f - a floating point number
s - a string

member.name: M:CreateObject
member.syntax: CreateObject(modelid, X, Y, Z, rX, rY, rZ, DrawDistance)
member.param: The model to create
Float The X coordinate to create the object at
Float The Y coordinate to create the object at
Float The Z coordinate to create the object at
Float The X rotation of the object
Float The Y rotation of the object
Float The Z rotation of the object
Float The distance that San Andreas renders objects at. 0.0 will cause objects to render at their default distances. Usable since 0.3b, limited to 300 prior to 0.3x (optional=0.0)
member.summary: Creates an object at specified coordinates in the game world.
member.remarks: Objects that emit light (lampposts, police lights, bollard lights, neons etc.) that have a greater rotation than 16.26 degrees (or -16.26) on either the X or Y axis will stop shining. This effect also applies to light objects attached to other objects, players and vehicles. If a light object is attached to a car and the car is rotated over 16.26 degrees (like in a rollover), the object will also stop emitting light. This is a GTA:SA issue and is not caused by a bug in SA-MP.

In case the light is attached to another object, one fix for this is to set SyncRotation to false in AttachObjectToObject. This will ensure the light stays at 0 rotation. This would only really work for objects that consist ONLY of light, so wouldn't work for the police light for example.
There is a limit of 1000 objects (MAX_OBJECTS). To circumvent this limit, you can use a streamer
member.returns: The ID of the object that was created, or INVALID_OBJECT_ID if the object limit (MAX_OBJECTS) was reached.

member.name: M:DestroyObject
member.param: The ID of the object to destroy. Returned by CreateObject
member.summary: Destroys (removes) an object that was created using CreateObject.

member.name: M:GetPlayerCameraAspectRatio
member.param: The ID of the player to get the camera aspect ratio of
member.summary: Retrieves the aspect ratio of a player's camera.
member.remarks: This function was added in SA-MP 0.3z and will not work in earlier versions!
The return value of this function represents the value of the "widescreen" option in the game's display settings, not the actual aspect ratio of the player's display.
member.returns: The aspect ratio of the player's camera, as a float. The aspect ratio can be one of three values: 4:3 (1.3333334, Float:0x3FAAAAAB) when widescreen is turned off, 5:4 (1.2470589, Float:0x3F9F9FA0) when letterbox mode is turned on, and 16:9 (1.7764707, Float:0x3FE36364) when widescreen is turned on regardless of the letterbox mode.

member.name: M:GetPlayerCameraFrontVector
member.param: The ID of the player you want to obtain the camera front vector of
Float & A float to store the X coordinate, passed by reference
Float & A float to store the Y coordinate, passed by reference
Float & A float to store the Z coordinate, passed by reference
member.summary: This function will return the current direction of player's aiming in 3-D space, the coords are relative to the camera position, see GetPlayerCameraPos.
member.remarks: This function was added in SA-MP 0.3a and will not work in earlier versions!
In 0.3a the camera front vector is only obtainable when player is inside a rhino, S.W.A.T tank, fire truck, or on foot.
Since 0.3b the camera data can be obtained when the player is in any vehicle or on foot.
member.returns: The position is stored in the specified variables.

member.name: M:GetPlayerCameraPos
member.param: The ID of the player to get the camera position of
Float & A float variable to store the X coordinate in, passed by reference
Float & A float variable to store the Y coordinate in, passed by reference
Float & A float variable to store the Z coordinate in, passed by reference
member.summary: Get the position of the player's camera.
member.remarks: This function was added in SA-MP 0.3a and will not work in earlier versions!
Player's camera positions are only updated once a second, unless aiming.
It is recommended to set a 1 second timer if you wish to take action that relies on a player's camera position.

member.name: M:GetPlayerFacingAngle
member.param: The player you want to get the angle of
Float & The Float to store the angle in, passed by reference
member.summary: Gets the angle a player is facing.
member.remarks: Angles are reversed in GTA:SA; 90 degrees would be East in the real world, but in GTA:SA 90 degrees is in fact West. North and South are still 0/360 and 180. To convert this, simply do 360 - angle.
Angles returned when inside a vehicle is rarely correct. To get the correct facing angle while inside a vehicle, use GetVehicleZAngle.

member.name: M:GetPlayerPos
member.param: The ID of the player to get the position of
Float & A float variable in which to store the X coordinate in, passed by reference
Float & A float variable in which to store the Y coordinate in, passed by reference
Float & A float variable in which to store the Z coordinate in, passed by reference
member.summary: Get the position of a player, represented by X, Y and Z coordinates.
member.remarks: This function is known to return unreliable values when used in OnPlayerDisconnect and OnPlayerRequestClass. This is because the player is not spawned.
member.returns: true on success, false on failure (i.e. player not connected).

member.name: M:NormCrossProduct
member.syntax: NormCrossProduct(v1x, v1y, v1z, v2x, v2y, v2z, &x, &y, &z)
member.param: Float First vector x
Float First vector y
Float First vector z
Float Second vector x
Float Second vector y
Float Second vector z
Float & Output vector x
Float & Output vector y
Float & Output vector z
member.summary: These values were gathered by assumption of the size of the screen
Calculates the CrossProduct and normalizes it

member.name: M:OnActorStreamIn
member.param: The ID of the actor that has been streamed in for the player
The ID of the player that streamed the actor in
member.summary: This callback is called when an actor is streamed in by a player's client.
member.remarks: This function was added in SA-MP 0.3.7 and will not work in earlier versions!
This callback can also be called by NPC.
It is always called first in filterscripts.
member.returns: This callback does not handle returns.

member.name: M:OnActorStreamOut
member.param: The ID of the actor that has been streamed out for the player
The ID of the player that streamed the actor out
member.summary: This callback is called when an actor is streamed out by a player's client.
member.remarks: This function was added in SA-MP 0.3.7 and will not work in earlier versions!
This callback can also be called by NPC.
It is always called first in filterscripts.
member.returns: This callback does not handle returns.

member.name: M:OnDialogResponse
member.param: The ID of the player that responded to the dialog
The ID of the dialog the player responded to, assigned in ShowPlayerDialog
1 for left button and 0 for right button (if only one button shown, always 1)
The ID of the list item selected by the player (starts at 0) (only if using a list style dialog)
[] The text entered into the input box by the player or the selected list item text
member.summary: This callback is called when a player responds to a dialog shown using ShowPlayerDialog by either clicking a button, pressing ENTER/ESC or double-clicking a list item (if using a list style dialog).
member.remarks: This callback was added in SA-MP 0.3a and will not work in earlier versions!

A player's dialog doesn't hide when the gamemode restarts, causing the server to print "Warning: PlayerDialogResponse PlayerId: 0 dialog ID doesn't match last sent dialog ID" if a player responded to this dialog after restart.
Parameters can contain different values, based on dialog's style.
member.returns:
Returning 0 in this callback will pass the dialog to another script in case no matching code were found in your gamemode's callback.
It is always called first in filterscripts so returning 1 there blocks other filterscripts from seeing it.

member.name: M:OnEnterExitModShop
member.param: The ID of the player that entered or exited the modshop
1 if the player entered or 0 if they exited
The interior ID of the modshop that the player is entering (or 0 if exiting)
member.summary: This callback is called when a player enters or exits a mod shop.
member.remarks: This callback was added in SA-MP 0.3a and will not work in earlier versions!
Players collide when they get into the same mod shop.
member.returns:
This callback does not handle returns.
It is always called first in filterscripts.

member.name: M:OnFilterScriptExit
member.summary: This callback is called when a filterscript is unloaded. It is only called inside the filterscript which is unloaded.
member.returns: This callback does not handle returns.

member.name: M:OnFilterScriptInit
member.summary: This callback is called when a filterscript is initialized (loaded). It is only called inside the filterscript which is starting.
member.returns: This callback does not handle returns.

member.name: M:OnGameModeExit
member.summary: This callback is called when a gamemode ends, either through 'gmx', the server being shut down, or GameModeExit.
member.remarks: This function can also be used in a filterscript to detect if the gamemode changes with RCON commands like changemode or gmx, as changing the gamemode does not reload a filterscript.

When using OnGameModeExit in conjunction with the 'rcon gmx' console command keep in mind there is a potential for client bugs to occur an example of this is excessive RemoveBuildingForPlayer calls during OnGameModeInit which could result in a client crash.
This callback will NOT be called if the server crashes or the process is killed by other means, such as using the Linux kill command or pressing the close-button on the Windows console.
member.returns:
0 - Will prevent other filterscripts from receiving this callback.
1 - Indicates that this callback will be passed to the next filterscript.
It is always called first in gamemode.

member.name: M:OnGameModeInit
member.summary: This callback is triggered when the gamemode starts.
member.remarks: This function can also be used in a filterscript to detect if the gamemode changes with RCON commands like changemode or gmx, as changing the gamemode does not reload a filterscript.
member.returns:
0 - Will prevent other filterscripts from receiving this callback.
1 - Indicates that this callback will be passed to the next filterscript.
It is always called first in gamemode.

member.name: M:OnIncomingConnection
member.param: The ID of the player attempting to connect
[] The IP address of the player attempting to connect
The port of the attempted connection
member.summary: This callback is called when an IP address attempts a connection to the server. To block incoming connections, use BlockIpAddress.
member.remarks: This callback was added in SA-MP 0.3z R2-2 and will not work in earlier versions!
member.returns:
1 - Will prevent other filterscripts from receiving this callback.
0 - Indicates that this callback will be passed to the next filterscript.
It is always called first in filterscripts.

member.name: M:OnObjectMoved
member.param: The ID of the object that was moved
member.summary: This callback is called when an object is moved after MoveObject (when it stops moving).
member.remarks: SetObjectPos does not work when used in this callback. To fix it, recreate the object.
member.returns:
This callback does not handle returns.
It is always called first in filterscripts.

member.name: M:OnPlayerClickMap
member.param: The ID of the player that placed a target/waypoint
Float The X float coordinate where the player clicked
Float The Y float coordinate where the player clicked
Float The Z float coordinate where the player clicked (inaccurate - see note below)
member.summary: OnPlayerClickMap is called when a player places a target/waypoint on the pause menu map (by right-clicking).
member.remarks: This callback was added in SA-MP 0.3d and will not work in earlier versions!
The Z value returned will be 0 (invalid) if it is far away from the player; use the MapAndreas plugin to get a more accurate Z coordinate.
member.returns:
1 - Will prevent other filterscripts from receiving this callback.
0 - Indicates that this callback will be passed to the next filterscript.
It is always called first in gamemode.

member.name: M:OnPlayerClickPlayer
member.param: The ID of the player that clicked on a player on the scoreboard
The ID of the player that was clicked on
The source of the player's click
member.summary: Called when a player double-clicks on a player on the scoreboard.
member.remarks: This callback was added in SA-MP 0.3a and will not work in earlier versions!
There is currently only one (0 - CLICK_SOURCE_SCOREBOARD). The existence of this argument suggests that more sources may be supported in the future.
member.returns:
1 - Will prevent other filterscripts from receiving this callback.
0 - Indicates that this callback will be passed to the next filterscript.
It is always called first in filterscripts.

member.name: M:OnPlayerClickPlayerTextDraw
member.param: The ID of the player that selected a textdraw
PlayerText The ID of the player-textdraw that the player selected
member.summary: This callback is called when a player clicks on a player-textdraw. It is not called when player cancels the select mode (ESC) - however, OnPlayerClickTextDraw is.
member.remarks: This callback was added in SA-MP 0.3e and will not work in earlier versions!
When a player presses ESC to cancel selecting a textdraw, OnPlayerClickTextDraw is called with a textdraw ID of INVALID_TEXT_DRAW. OnPlayerClickPlayerTextDraw won't be called also.
member.returns:
Returning 1 in this callback will prevent it being called in other scripts. This should be used to signal that the textdraw on which they clicked was 'found' and no further processing is needed. You should return 0 if the textdraw on which they clicked wasn't found, just like in OnPlayerCommandText.
It is always called first in filterscripts so returning 1 there also blocks other scripts from seeing it.

member.name: M:OnPlayerClickTextDraw
member.param: The ID of the player that clicked on the textdraw
Text The ID of the clicked textdraw. INVALID_TEXT_DRAW if selection was cancelled
member.summary: This callback is called when a player clicks on a textdraw or cancels the select mode with the Escape key.
member.remarks: This callback was added in SA-MP 0.3e and will not work in earlier versions!
The clickable area is defined by TextDrawTextSize. The x and y parameters passed to that function must not be zero or negative.
Do not use CancelSelectTextDraw unconditionally within this callback. This results in an infinite loop.
member.returns:
Returning 1 in this callback will prevent it being called in other scripts. This should be used to signal that the textdraw on which they clicked was 'found' and no further processing is needed. You should return 0 if the textdraw on which they clicked wasn't found, just like in OnPlayerCommandText.
It is always called first in filterscripts so returning 1 there also blocks other scripts from seeing it.

member.name: M:OnPlayerCommandText
member.param: The ID of the player that entered a command
[] The command that was entered (including the forward slash)
member.summary: This callback is called when a player enters a command into the client chat window. Commands are anything that start with a forward slash, e.g. /help.
member.remarks: This callback can also be called by NPC.
member.returns:
Return 1 if the command was processed, otherwise 0; If the command was not found both in filterscripts and in gamemode, the player will be received a message: SERVER: Unknown command.
It is always called first in filterscripts so returning 1 there blocks other scripts from seeing it.

member.name: M:OnPlayerConnect
member.param: The ID of the player that connected
member.summary: This callback is called when a player connects to the server.
member.remarks: This callback can also be called by NPC.
member.returns:
0 - Will prevent other filterscripts from receiving this callback.
1 - Indicates that this callback will be passed to the next filterscript.
It is always called first in filterscripts.

member.name: M:OnPlayerDeath
member.param: The ID of the player that died
The ID of the player that killed the player who died, or INVALID_PLAYER_ID if there was none
The ID of the reason for the player's death
member.summary: This callback is called when a player dies, either by suicide or by being killed by another player.
member.remarks:
The reason will return 37 (flame thrower) from any fire sources (e.g. molotov, 18)
The reason will return 51 from any weapon that creates an explosion (e.g. RPG, grenade)
You do not need to check whether killerid is valid before using it in SendDeathMessage. INVALID_PLAYER_ID is a valid killerid ID parameter in that function.
playerid is the only one who can call the callback. (good to know for anti fake death)
member.returns:
0 - Will prevent other filterscripts from receiving this callback.
1 - Indicates that this callback will be passed to the next filterscript.
It is always called first in filterscripts.

member.name: M:OnPlayerDisconnect
member.param: The ID of the player that disconnected
The reason for the disconnection. See table below
member.summary: This callback is called when a player disconnects from the server.
member.remarks: This callback can also be called by NPC.

Some functions might not work correctly when used in this callback because the player is already disconnected when the callback is called. This means that you can't get unambiguous information from functions like GetPlayerIp and GetPlayerPos.

ul.li: 0 - timeout/Crash - the player's connection was lost. Either their game crashed or their network had a fault.
1 - quit - the player purposefully quit, either using the /quit (/q) command or via the pause menu.
2 - kick/ban - the player was kicked or banned by the server.

member.returns:
0 - Will prevent other filterscripts from receiving this callback.
1 - Indicates that this callback will be passed to the next filterscript.
It is always called first in filterscripts.

member.name: M:OnPlayerEditAttachedObject
member.syntax: OnPlayerEditAttachedObject(playerid, response, index, modelid, boneid, fOffsetX, fOffsetY, fOffsetZ, fRotX, fRotY, fRotZ, fScaleX, fScaleY, fScaleZ)
member.param: The ID of the player that ended edition mode
0 if they cancelled (ESC) or 1 if they clicked the save icon
The index of the attached object
The model of the attached object that was edited
The bone of the attached object that was edited
Float The X offset for the attached object that was edited
Float The Y offset for the attached object that was edited
Float The Z offset for the attached object that was edited
Float The X rotation for the attached object that was edited
Float The Y rotation for the attached object that was edited
Float The Z rotation for the attached object that was edited
Float The X scale for the attached object that was edited
Float The Y scale for the attached object that was edited
Float The Z scale for the attached object that was edited
member.summary: This callback is called when a player ends attached object edition mode.
member.remarks: This callback was added in SA-MP 0.3e and will not work in earlier versions!
Editions should be discarded if response was 0 (cancelled). This must be done by storing the offsets etc. in an array BEFORE using EditAttachedObject.
member.returns:
1 - Will prevent other scripts from receiving this callback.
0 - Indicates that this callback will be passed to the next script.
It is always called first in filterscripts.

member.name: M:OnPlayerEditObject
member.syntax: OnPlayerEditObject(playerid, playerobject, objectid, response, fX, fY, fZ, fRotX, fRotY, fRotZ)
member.param: The ID of the player that edited an object
0 if it is a global object or 1 if it is a playerobject
The ID of the edited object
The type of response
Float The X offset for the object that was edited
Float The Y offset for the object that was edited
Float The Z offset for the object that was edited
Float The X rotation for the object that was edited
Float The Y rotation for the object that was edited
Float The Z rotation for the object that was edited
member.summary: This callback is called when a player finishes editing an object (EditObject/EditPlayerObject).
member.remarks: This callback was added in SA-MP 0.3e and will not work in earlier versions!

When using EDIT_RESPONSE_UPDATE be aware that this callback will not be called when releasing an edit in progress resulting in the last update of EDIT_RESPONSE_UPDATE being out of sync of the objects current position.
member.returns:
1 - Will prevent other scripts from receiving this callback.
0 - Indicates that this callback will be passed to the next script.
It is always called first in filterscripts.

member.name: M:OnPlayerEnterCheckpoint
member.param: The player who entered the checkpoint
member.summary: This callback is called when a player enters the checkpoint set for that player.
member.remarks: This callback can also be called by NPC.
member.returns:
This callback does not handle returns.
It is always called first in filterscripts.

member.name: M:OnPlayerEnterRaceCheckpoint
member.param: The ID of the player who entered the race checkpoint
member.summary: This callback is called when a player enters a race checkpoint.
member.remarks: This callback can also be called by NPC.
member.returns:
This callback does not handle returns.
It is always called first in filterscripts.

member.name: M:OnPlayerEnterVehicle
member.param: ID of the player who attempts to enter a vehicle
ID of the vehicle the player is attempting to enter
0 if entering as driver. 1 if entering as passenger
member.summary: This callback is called when a player starts to enter a vehicle, meaning the player is not in vehicle yet at the time this callback is called.
member.remarks: This callback is called when a player BEGINS to enter a vehicle, not when they HAVE entered it. See OnPlayerStateChange.
This callback is still called if the player is denied entry to the vehicle (e.g. it is locked or full).
member.returns:
This callback does not handle returns.
It is always called first in filterscripts.

member.name: M:OnPlayerExitVehicle
member.param: The ID of the player that is exiting a vehicle
The ID of the vehicle the player is exiting
member.summary: This callback is called when a player starts to exit a vehicle.
member.remarks: Not called if the player falls off a bike or is removed from a vehicle by other means such as using SetPlayerPos.
You must use OnPlayerStateChange and check if their old state is PLAYER_STATE_DRIVER or PLAYER_STATE_PASSENGER and their new state is PLAYER_STATE_ONFOOT.
member.returns:
This callback does not handle returns.
It is always called first in filterscripts.

member.name: M:OnPlayerExitedMenu
member.param: The ID of the player that exited the menu
member.summary: Called when a player exits a menu.
member.returns:
This callback does not handle returns.
It is always called first in gamemode.

member.name: M:OnPlayerFinishedDownloading
member.param: The ID of the player that finished downloading custom models
The ID of the virtual world the player finished downloading custom models for
member.summary: This callback is called when a player finishes downloading custom models. For more information on how to add custom models to your server, see the release thread and this tutorial.
member.remarks: This callback was added in SA-MP 0.3DL and will not work in earlier versions!
This callback is called every time a player changes virtual worlds, even if there are no custom models present in that world.
member.returns: This callback does not handle returns.

member.name: M:OnPlayerGiveDamage
member.param: The ID of the player that gave damage
The ID of the player that received damage
Float The amount of health/armour damagedid has lost (combined)
The reason that caused the damage
The body part that was hit. (NOTE: This parameter was added in 0.3z. Leave it out if using an older version!)
member.summary: This callback is called when a player gives damage to another player.
member.remarks: This callback was added in SA-MP 0.3d and will not work in earlier versions!

Keep in mind this function can be inaccurate in some cases.
If you want to prevent certain players from damaging eachother, use SetPlayerTeam.
The weaponid will return 37 (flame thrower) from any fire sources (e.g. molotov, 18)
The weaponid will return 51 from any weapon that creates an explosion (e.g. RPG, grenade)
playerid is the only one who can call the callback.
The amount is always the maximum damage the weaponid can do, even when the health left is less than that maximum damage. So when a player has 100.0 health and gets shot with a Desert Eagle which has a damage value of 46.2, it takes 3 shots to kill that player. All 3 shots will show an amount of 46.2, even though when the last shot hits, the player only has 7.6 health left.
member.returns:
1 - Callback will not be called in other filterscripts.
0 - Allows this callback to be called in other filterscripts.
It is always called first in filterscripts so returning 1 there blocks other filterscripts from seeing it.

member.name: M:OnPlayerGiveDamageActor
member.param: The ID of the player that gave damage
The ID of the actor that received damage
Float The amount of health/armour damaged_actorid has lost
The reason that caused the damage
The body part that was hit
member.summary: This callback is called when a player gives damage to an actor.
member.remarks: This callback was added in SA-MP 0.3.7 and will not work in earlier versions!
This function does not get called if the actor is set invulnerable (WHICH IS BY DEFAULT). See SetActorInvulnerable.
member.returns:
1 - Callback will not be called in other filterscripts.
0 - Allows this callback to be called in other filterscripts.
It is always called first in filterscripts so returning 1 there blocks other filterscripts from seeing it.

member.name: M:OnPlayerInteriorChange
member.param: The playerid who changed interior
The interior the player is now in
The interior the player was in before
member.summary: Called when a player changes interior. Can be triggered by SetPlayerInterior or when a player enter/exits a building.
member.returns:
This callback does not handle returns.
It is always called first in gamemode.

member.name: M:OnPlayerKeyStateChange

A map (bitmask) of the keys held prior to the current change - see here
member.summary: This callback is called when the state of any supported key is changed (pressed/released). Directional keys do not trigger OnPlayerKeyStateChange (up/down/left/right).
member.remarks: This callback can also be called by NPC.

This callback does not handle returns.
It is always called first in gamemode.

member.name: M:OnPlayerPickUpPickup

The ID of the pickup, returned by CreatePickup

This callback does not handle returns.
It is always called first in gamemode.

member.name: M:OnPlayerRequestClass
member.param: The ID of the player that changed class
The ID of the current class being viewed (returned by AddPlayerClass)
member.summary: Called when a player changes class at class selection (and when class selection first appears).
member.remarks: This callback can also be called by NPC.
This callback is also called when a player presses F4.
member.returns:
Returning 0 in this callback will prevent the player from spawning. The player can be forced to spawn when SpawnPlayer is used.
It is always called first in filterscripts.

member.name: M:OnPlayerRequestSpawn
member.param: The ID of the player that requested to spawn
member.summary: Called when a player attempts to spawn via class selection either by pressing SHIFT or clicking the 'Spawn' button.
member.remarks: This callback can also be called by NPC.
To prevent players from spawning with certain classes, the last viewed class must be saved in a variable in OnPlayerRequestClass.
member.returns:
Returning 0 in this callback will prevent the player from spawning.
It is always called first in filterscripts so returning 0 there also blocks other scripts from seeing it.

member.name: M:OnPlayerSelectObject
member.syntax: OnPlayerSelectObject(playerid, type, objectid, modelid, fX, fY, fZ)
member.param: The ID of the player that selected an object
The type of selection
The ID of the selected object
The model ID of the selected object
Float The X position of the selected object
Float The Y position of the selected object
Float The Z position of the selected object
member.summary: This callback is called when a player selects an object after SelectObject has been used.
member.remarks: This function was added in SA-MP 0.3e and will not work in earlier versions!
member.returns:
1 - Will prevent other scripts from receiving this callback.
0 - Indicates that this callback will be passed to the next script.
It is always called first in filterscripts.

member.name: M:OnPlayerSelectedMenuRow
member.param: The ID of the player that selected a menu item
The ID of the row that was selected. The first row is ID 0
member.summary: This callback is called when a player selects an item from a menu (ShowMenuForPlayer).
member.remarks: The menu ID is not passed to this callback. GetPlayerMenu must be used to determine which menu the player selected an item on.
member.returns:
This callback does not handle returns.
It is always called first in gamemode.

member.name: M:OnPlayerSpawn
member.param: The ID of the player that spawned
member.summary: This callback is called when a player spawns.(i.e. after caling SpawnPlayer function).
member.remarks: This callback can also be called by NPC.
The game sometimes deducts $100 from players after spawn.
member.returns:
0 - Will prevent other filterscripts from receiving this callback.
1 - Indicates that this callback will be passed to the next filterscript.
It is always called first in filterscripts.

member.name: M:OnPlayerStateChange
member.param: The ID of the player that changed state
The player's new state
The player's previous state
member.summary: This callback is called when a player changes state. For example, when a player changes from being the driver of a vehicle to being on-foot.
member.remarks: This callback can also be called by NPC.

ul.li: PLAYER_STATE_DRIVER - player is the driver of a vehicle
PLAYER_STATE_PASSENGER - player is passenger of a vehicle
PLAYER_STATE_WASTED - player is dead or on class selection
PLAYER_STATE_ENTER_VEHICLE_DRIVER - player enters a vehicle as driver
PLAYER_STATE_ENTER_VEHICLE_PASSENGER - player enters a vehicle as passenger

member.returns:
This callback does not handle returns.
It is always called first in filterscripts.

member.name: M:OnPlayerStreamIn
member.param: The ID of the player who has been streamed
The ID of the player that streamed the other player in
member.summary: This callback is called when a player is streamed by some other player's client.
member.remarks: This callback was added in SA-MP 0.3a and will not work in earlier versions!
This callback can also be called by NPC.
member.returns:
This callback does not handle returns.
It is always called first in filterscripts.

member.name: M:OnPlayerStreamOut
member.param: The player who has been destreamed
The player who has destreamed the other player
member.summary: This callback is called when a player is streamed out from some other player's client.
member.remarks: This callback was added in SA-MP 0.3a and will not work in earlier versions!
This callback can also be called by NPC.
member.returns:
This callback does not handle returns.
It is always called first in filterscripts.

member.name: M:OnPlayerTakeDamage
member.param: The ID of the player that took damage
The ID of the player that caused the damage. INVALID_PLAYER_ID if self-inflicted
Float The amount of damage the player took (health and armour combined)
The ID of the weapon/reason for the damage
The body part that was hit. (NOTE: This parameter was added in 0.3z. Leave it out if using an older version!)
member.summary: This callback is called when a player takes damage.
member.remarks: This callback was added in SA-MP 0.3d and will not work in earlier versions!
GetPlayerHealth and GetPlayerArmour will return the old amounts of the player before this callback.

The weaponid will return 37 (flame thrower) from any fire sources (e.g. molotov, 18).
The weaponid will return 51 from any weapon that creates an explosion (e.g. RPG, grenade)
playerid is the only one who can call the callback.
The amount is always the maximum damage the weaponid can do, even when the health left is less than that maximum damage. So when a player has 100.0 health and gets shot with a Desert Eagle which has a damage value of 46.2, it takes 3 shots to kill that player. All 3 shots will show an amount of 46.2, even though when the last shot hits, the player only has 7.6 health left.
member.returns:
1 - Callback will not be called in other filterscripts.
0 - Allows this callback to be called in other filterscripts.
It is always called first in filterscripts so returning 1 there blocks other filterscripts from seeing it.

member.name: M:OnPlayerText
member.param: The ID of the player who typed the text
[] The text the player typed
member.summary: Called when a player sends a chat message.
member.remarks: This callback can also be called by NPC.
member.returns:
Returning 0 in this callback will stop the text from being sent to all players.
It is always called first in filterscripts so returning 0 there blocks other scripts from seeing it.

member.name: M:OnPlayerUpdate
member.param: ID of the player sending an update packet
member.summary: This callback is called every time a client/player updates the server with their status. It is often used to create custom callbacks for client updates that aren't actively tracked by the server, such as health or armor updates or players switching weapons.
member.remarks: This callback can also be called by NPC.
This callback is called, on average, 30 times per second, per player; only use it when you know what it's meant for (or more importantly what it's NOT meant for).
The frequency with which this callback is called for each player varies, depending on what the player is doing. Driving or shooting will trigger a lot more updates than idling.
member.returns:
0 - Update from this player will not be replicated to other clients.
1 - Indicates that this update can be processed normally and sent to other players.
It is always called first in filterscripts.

member.name: M:OnPlayerWeaponShot
member.syntax: OnPlayerWeaponShot(playerid, weaponid, hittype, hitid, fX, fY, fZ)
member.param: The ID of the player that shot a weapon
The ID of the weapon shot by the player
The type of thing the shot hit (none, player, vehicle, or (player)object)
The ID of the player, vehicle or object that was hit
Float The X coordinate that the shot hit
Float The Y coordinate that the shot hit
Float The Z coordinate that the shot hit
member.summary: This callback is called when a player fires a shot from a weapon. Only bullet weapons are supported. Only passenger drive-by is supported (not driver drive-by, and not sea sparrow / hunter shots).
member.remarks: This callback was added in SA-MP 0.3z and will not work in earlier versions!
BULLET_HIT_TYPE_PLAYER is also called for NPCs. Actors are ignored by this callback and detects as BULLET_HIT_TYPE_NONE.
This callback is only called when lag compensation is enabled.

Isn't called if you fired in vehicle as driver or if you are looking behind with the aim enabled (shooting in air).
It is called as BULLET_HIT_TYPE_VEHICLE with the correct hitid (the hit player's vehicleid) if you are shooting a player which is in a vehicle. It won't be called as BULLET_HIT_TYPE_PLAYER at all.
Partially fixed in SA-MP 0.3.7: If fake weapon data is sent by a malicious user, other player clients may freeze or crash. To combat this, check if the reported weaponid can actually fire bullets.
GetPlayerLastShotVectors can be used in this callback for more detailed bullet vector information.
member.returns:
0 - Prevent the bullet from causing damage.
1 - Allow the bullet to cause damage.
It is always called first in filterscripts so returning 0 there also blocks other scripts from seeing it.

member.name: M:OnRconCommand
member.param: [] A string containing the command that was typed, as well as any passed parameters
member.summary: This callback is called when a command is sent through the server console, remote RCON, or via the in-game "/rcon command".
member.remarks: You will need to include this callback in a loaded filterscript for it to work in the gamemode!
"/rcon" is not included in "cmd" when a player types a command.
If you use the print function here, it will send a message to the player who typed the command in-game as well as the log.
This callback is not called when the player is not logged in as RCON admin.

When the player is not logged in as RCON admin and uses /rcon login, this callback will not be called and OnRconLoginAttempt is called instead. However, when the player is logged in as RCON admin, the use of this command will call this callback.
member.returns:
0 if the command was not processed, it will be passed to another script or 1 if the command was processed, will not be passed to other scripts.
It is always called first in filterscripts so returning 1 there blocks gamemode from seeing it.

member.name: M:OnRconLoginAttempt
member.param: [] The IP of the player that tried to log in to RCON
[] The password used to login with
0 if the password was incorrect or 1 if it was correct
member.summary: This callback is called when someone attempts to log in to RCON in-game; successful or not.
member.remarks: This callback was added in SA-MP 0.3a and will not work in earlier versions!
This callback is only called when /rcon login is used in-game.
This callback is only called when the player is not yet logged in. When the player is logged in, OnRconCommand is called instead.
member.returns:
This callback does not handle returns.
It is always called first in filterscripts.

member.name: M:OnTrailerUpdate
member.param: The ID of the player who sent a trailer update
The Trailer being updated
member.summary: This callback is called when a player sent a trailer update.
member.remarks: This callback was added in SA-MP 0.3z R4 and will not work in earlier versions!
This callback is called very frequently per second per trailer. You should refrain from implementing intensive calculations or intensive file writing/reading operations in this callback.
member.returns:
0 - Cancels any trailer updates from being sent to other players. Update is still sent to the updating player.
1 - Processes the trailer update as normal and synchronizes it between all players.
It is always called first in filterscripts.

member.name: M:OnUnoccupiedVehicleUpdate
member.syntax: OnUnoccupiedVehicleUpdate(vehicleid, playerid, passenger_seat, new_x, new_y, new_z, vel_x, vel_y, vel_z)
member.param: The ID of the vehicle that's position was updated
The ID of the player that sent a vehicle position sync update
The ID of the seat if the player is a passenger. 0=not in vehicle, 1=front passenger, 2=backleft 3=backright 4+ is for coach/bus etc. with many passenger seats
Float The new X coordinate of the vehicle. This parameter was added in 0.3z. Leave it out if using an earlier version
Float The new Y coordinate of the vehicle. This parameter was added in 0.3z. Leave it out if using an earlier version
Float The new Z coordinate of the vehicle. This parameter was added in 0.3z. Leave it out if using an earlier version
Float The new X velocity of the vehicle. This parameter was added in 0.3z R4. Leave it out if using an earlier version
Float The new Y velocity of the vehicle. This parameter was added in 0.3z R4. Leave it out if using an earlier version
Float The new Z velocity of the vehicle. This parameter was added in 0.3z R4. Leave it out if using an earlier version
member.summary: This callback is called when a player's client updates/syncs the position of a vehicle they're not driving. This can happen outside of the vehicle or when the player is a passenger of a vehicle that has no driver.
member.remarks: This callback was added in SA-MP 0.3c R3 and will not work in earlier versions!
This callback is called very frequently per second per unoccupied vehicle. You should refrain from implementing intensive calculations or intensive file writing/reading operations in this callback.
GetVehiclePos will return the old coordinates of the vehicle before this update.
member.returns:
Returning 0 in this callback will stop the vehicle's position being synced to other players. Update is still sent to the updating player. Useful for combating vehicle teleport hacks.
It is always called first in filterscripts so returning 0 there also blocks other scripts from seeing it.

member.name: M:OnVehicleDamageStatusUpdate
member.param: The ID of the vehicle that was changed its damage status
The ID of the player who synced the change in the damage status (who had the car damaged or repaired)
member.summary: This callback is called when a vehicle element such as doors, tires, panels, or lights change their damage status.
member.remarks: This callback was added in SA-MP 0.3a and will not work in earlier versions!
This does not include vehicle health changes
member.returns:
1 - Will prevent other filterscripts from receiving this callback.
0 - Indicates that this callback will be passed to the next filterscript.
It is always called first in filterscripts.

member.name: M:OnVehicleDeath
member.param: The ID of the vehicle that was destroyed
The ID of the player that reported (synced) the vehicle's destruction (name is misleading). Generally the driver or a passenger (if any) or the closest player
member.summary: This callback is called when a vehicle is destroyed - either by exploding or becoming submerged in water.
member.remarks: This callback can also be called by NPC.

This callback will also be called when a vehicle enters water, but the vehicle can be saved from destruction by teleportation or driving out (if only partially submerged). The callback won't be called a second time, and the vehicle may disappear when the driver exits, or after a short time.
member.returns:
This callback does not handle returns.
It is always called first in filterscripts.

member.name: M:OnVehicleMod
member.param: The ID of the driver of the vehicle
The ID of the vehicle which is modded
The ID of the component which was added to the vehicle
member.summary: This callback is called when a vehicle is modded.
member.remarks: This callback is NOT called by AddVehicleComponent.
member.returns:
Return 0 to desync the mod (or an invalid mod) from propagating and / or crashing players.
It is always called first in gamemode so returning 0 there also blocks other filterscripts from seeing it.

member.name: M:OnVehiclePaintjob
member.param: The ID of the player that changed the paintjob of their vehicle
The ID of the vehicle that had its paintjob changed
The ID of the new paintjob
member.summary: Called when a player previews a vehicle paintjob inside a mod shop. Watch out, this callback is not called when the player buys the paintjob.
member.remarks: This callback is not called by ChangeVehiclePaintjob.
member.returns:
This callback does not handle returns. Returning 0 won't deny the paintjob change.
It is always called first in gamemode so returning 0 there blocks other filterscripts from seeing it.

member.name: M:OnVehicleRespray
member.param: The ID of the player that is driving the vehicle
The ID of the vehicle that was resprayed
The color that the vehicle's primary color was changed to
The color that the vehicle's secondary color was changed to
member.summary: This callback is called when a player exits a mod shop, even if the colors weren't changed. Watch out, the name is ambiguous, Pay 'n' Spray shops don't call this callback.
member.remarks: Previewing a component inside a mod shop might call this callback.
This callback is not called by ChangeVehicleColor.
member.returns:
Returning 0 in this callback will deny the colour change. Returning 1 will allow it. This can be used to prevent hackers from changing vehicle colours using cheats.
It is always called first in gamemode so returning 0 there also blocks other filterscripts from seeing it.

member.name: M:OnVehicleSirenStateChange
member.param: The ID of the player that toggled the siren (driver)
The ID of the vehicle of which the siren was toggled for
0 if siren was turned off, 1 if siren was turned on
member.summary: This callback is called when a vehicle's siren is toggled.
member.remarks: This callback was added in SA-MP 0.3.7 and will not work in earlier versions!
This callback can also be called by NPC.
This callback is only called when a vehicle's siren is toggled on or off, NOT when the alternate siren is in use (holding horn).
member.returns:
1 - Will prevent gamemode from receiving this callback.
0 - Indicates that this callback will be passed to the gamemode.
It is always called first in filterscripts.

member.name: M:OnVehicleSpawn
member.param: The ID of the vehicle that spawned
member.summary: This callback is called when a vehicle respawns.
member.returns:
0 - Will prevent other filterscripts from receiving this callback.
1 - Indicates that this callback will be passed to the next filterscript.
It is always called first in filterscripts.

member.name: M:OnVehicleStreamIn

The ID of the player who the vehicle streamed in for

member.remarks: This callback was added in SA-MP 0.3a and will not work in earlier versions!
This callback can also be called by NPC.
member.returns:
This callback does not handle returns.

if the ray collided with water
The model of the object the ray collided

member.name: M:floatabs
member.param: Float The float value to get the absolute value of
member.summary: This function returns the absolute value of float.
member.returns: The absolute value of the float (as a float value).

member.name: M:floatadd
member.param: Float First float
Float Second float
member.summary: Adds two floats together. This function is redundant as the standard operator (+) does the same thing.
member.returns: The sum of the two given floats.

member.name: M:floatcmp
member.param: Float The first float value to compare
Float The second float value to compare
member.summary: floatcmp can be used to compare float values to each other, to validate the comparison.
member.returns: 0 if value does match, 1 if the first value is bigger and -1 if the 2nd value is bigger.

member.name: M:floatcos
member.param: Float The angle from which to get the cosine
anglemode The angle mode (see below) to use, depending on the value entered (optional=radian)
member.summary: Get the cosine from a given angle. The input angle may be in radians, degrees or grades.
member.remarks: GTA/SA-MP use degrees for angles in most circumstances, for example GetPlayerFacingAngle. Therefore, it is most likely you'll want to use the degrees angle mode, not radians.
Also note that angles in GTA are counterclockwise; 270� is East and 90� is West. South is still 180� and North still 0�/360�.
member.returns: The cosine of the value entered.

member.name: M:floatdiv
member.param: Float First float
Float Second float (dividates the first float.)
member.summary: Divide one float by another one. Redundant as the division operator (/) does the same thing.
member.returns: The quotient of the two given floats.

member.name: M:floatmul
member.param: Float First Float
Float Second Float, the first one gets multiplied with
member.summary: Multiplies two floats with each other.
member.returns: The product of the two given floats.

member.name: M:floatround
member.param: Float The value to round
floatround_method The floatround method to use (optional=floatround_round)
member.summary: Round a floating point number to an integer value.

ul.li: floatround_round - round to the nearest integer. A fractional part of exactly 0.5 rounds upwards (this is the default).
floatround_tozero - round downwards for positive values and upwards for negative values ("truncate").

member.returns: The rounded value as an integer.

member.name: M:floatsin
member.param: Float The angle from which to get the sine
anglemode The angle mode (see below) to use, depending on the value entered (optional=radian)
member.summary: Get the sine from a given angle. The input angle may be in radians, degrees or grades.
member.remarks: GTA/SA-MP use degrees for angles in most circumstances, for example GetPlayerFacingAngle. Therefore, it is most likely you'll want to use the degrees angle mode, not radians.
Also note that angles in GTA are counterclockwise; 270� is East and 90� is West. South is still 180� and North still 0�/360�.
member.returns: The sine of the value entered.

member.name: M:floatsqroot
member.param: Float The value to calculate the square root of
member.summary: Calculates the square root of given value.
member.remarks: This function raises a "domain" error if the input value is negative. You may use floatabs to get the absolute (positive) value.
member.returns: The square root of the input value, as a float.

member.name: M:floatsub
member.param: Float First Float
Float Second Float (gets subtracted from the first float.)
member.summary: Subtracts one float from another one. Note that this function has no real use, as one can simply use the standard operator (-) instead.
member.returns: The difference of the two given floats.

member.name: M:funcidx
member.param: [] The name of the public function to get the ID of
member.summary: This function returns the ID of a public function by its name.
member.returns: The ID of the function (IDs start at 0). -1 if the function doesn't exist.

member.name: M:strcat
member.param: [] The string to store the two concatenated strings in
[] The source string
The maximum length of the destination (optional=sizeof dest)
member.summary: This function concatenates (joins together) two strings into the destination string.
member.returns: The length of the new destination string.

member.name: M:strcmp
member.param: [] The first string to compare
[] The second string to compare
bool When set to true, the case doesn't matter - HeLLo is the same as Hello. When false, they're not the same (optional=0)
When this length is set, the first x chars will be compared - doing "Hello" and "Hell No" with a length of 4 will say it's the same string (optional=cellmax)
member.summary: Compares two strings to see if they are the same.
member.remarks: This function returns 0 if either string is empty. Check for null strings with isnull(). If you do not, for example, people can login to anyone's account by simply entering a blank password.
If you compare strings from a text file, you should take in to account the 'carriage return' and 'new line' special characters (\r \n), as they are included, when using fread.
member.returns:
0 if strings match each other on given length;.
1 or -1 if some character do not match: string1[i] - string2[i].
difference in number of characters if one string matches only part of another string.

member.name: M:strcopy
member.param: [] The string to copy the source string into
[] The source string
The maximum length of the destination (optional=sizeof dest)
member.summary: Copies a string into the destination string.
member.returns: The length of the new destination string.

member.name: M:strequal
member.param: [] The first string to compare
[] The second string to compare
bool When set to true, the case doesn't matter - HeLLo is the same as Hello. When false, they're not the same (optional=0)
When this length is set, the first x chars will be compared - doing "Hello" and "Hell No" with a length of 4 will say it's the same string (optional=cellmax)
member.summary: Compares two strings to see if they are the same.
member.remarks: This is a conveniece function that depends on strcmp.
member.returns: true if the strings match each other on given length, false otherwise.
